results.title: Mouth to mouth rescue breathing
results.creator_credit: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research
results.brief_description: A record of an experiment at the Baltimore City Hospital Department of Anesthiology, in the methods and effectiveness of mouth-to-mouth rescue breathing in comparison with back pressure artificial respiration.

results.title: Mouth to mouth (AFC)
results.creator_credit: John Sainken, Vega Film Productions, Victorian Film Corporation and John Duigan
results.brief_description: Two teenage girls escape from a youth training centre and head for the city finding work in a food bar. Eventually they end up sharing a derelict warehouse with two unemployed boys they have met, one from an Italian family and the other from the country, and for awhile the openness and warmth of their relationships transcend their depressing economic circumstances. This is a film about survival, interpersonal relationships and the inevitable disintegration of the group. Cast includes Kim Krejus, Sonia Peat, Ian Gilmour, Sergio Frazetto. Cinematography by Tow Cowan; Nigel Buesst as camera assistant.

results.title: Moussorgsky: 'Pictures at an exhibition'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the flower gardens at Paris’ Louvre and Tuileries Park, children playing, fluffy chicks running about, the bustling market place at Limoges and the Paris Catacombs are shown to express part of Moussorgsky’s composition “Pictures at an Exhibition”. The composer wrote the music to pay homage to paintings by his friend Victor Hartmann.

results.title: Mouse-activated candle lighter
results.creator_credit: Prism Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: The mouse-activated candle lighter illustrates various forms of potential and kinetic energy. It is made from a mousetrap, fishing rod, alarm clock, ice-pack, train motor, rubberband, match and candle. Students are challenged to find the many forms of energy hidden in the mechanism and their movements. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mountains, materials and technology
results.creator_credit: Bob Thorpe, London Television Service and Mike Lockey
results.brief_description: Examines some of the latest developments to help people survive in hostile environments. Discusses the manufacture of new fabrics which have been used to design a new generation of tents, clothing and sleeping bags for surviving high altitude conditions. Also looks at how the use of a global positioning system can be used to help the lives of people stranded at sea or on land.

results.title: Mountains of adventure
results.brief_description: A fascinating documentary looking at two very different mountain ranges and how they are conquered by a small group of Aussie adventurers. The group flew to India to trek into the hidden kingdom of Zanskar, far north of Delhi through the highlands, to altitudes over 10,000 feet above sea level. They then rafted down white water rapids to Shingo La Pass at the Zanskar - before travelling to Kashmir. The second leg of this extraordinary journey took them to the New Zealand Alps, where they were caught in the worst weather experienced on Mount Victoria over 45 years. An amazing rescue sequence follows.

results.title: Mountain sanctuary
results.brief_description: In Western Tasmania, rugged mountain peaks and secret Alpine lakes beckon the bush walker and mountaineer. Explores thoroughly the beautiful Tasmanian highlands where unique flora and fauna, including Tasmanian devils, wombats, native cats, and black swans are found.

results.title: Mountain People
results.brief_description: Contrasts lifestyles of the Swiss people of Guarda and the Gurungs of Nepal. Looks at the way in which people isolated by mountains retain their cultures and way of life. No other credits available.
